intro: Porophyllum tridentatum, commonly known as the three-toothed cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Porophyllum tridentatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in open, sunny habitats.
